HTML:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.


LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.


THE ROLE & THE TEAMüë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

During 2020, Hostelworld pivoted from a more traditional functional CMO/CPO/CTO organisation to a ‚Äòfull ownership‚Äù growth team plus platform team model. More specifically, we established four growth teams to cover all consumer /hostel facing Apps and channels that reported into the CPO; and a separate CTO organisation that became responsible for supplying and maintaining common core services (such as inventory pricing, availability and checkout) via APIs to these four growth teams. Each of these four growth teams comprise resources that report into the CPO and dedicated resources drawn from the engineering function (developers, QA resources) and analytics function. Collectively, these four growth teams comprise ~ 50 headcount and are wholly accountable for their KPIs and roadmaps


We currently have four growth teams and four further central/support teams as follows;

  • Paid performance team : responsible for growing and optimising our paid web channels, including (web) landing page optimisation
  • Core team : responsible for our progressive web app (PWA Website), our organic web channels such as SEO, and more generally our core OTA funnel performance
  • Mobile/Social team : responsible for our iOS and Android Apps, including paid and organic downloads, CRM strategy and more generally our social network and event management (LinkUps) platforms
  • Supply team : responsible for all our hostel facing platforms and tools, supporting our two sided marketplace through collaboration with our customer facing teams and leading on our inventory, availability and rates position[LR1]
  • Product Design (Central) team : responsible for defining and implementing a uniform User Interface/Experience design language across our consumer and supplier facing Apps, consistent with our Mission and Brand
  • Content and Creative (Central) team : responsible for defining and leading the creative direction for Hostelworld, delivering content primarily through the four Growth teams above but also supporting the wider business needs with copywriting, content writing, graphic design and video production assets
  • Product and Technology Operations (Central) team : primarily responsible for driving alignment and coordination across the Growth and Technology teams quarterly roadmap planning process; and managing vendor spend across these two teams which accounts for the vast majority of non Wages and Salaries expenditure across the company
  • Customer Service (Support) team : responsible for handling all consumer support queries, mostly via webform/chat and email across 19 languages.


WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Stakeholder Collaboration:

  • Partner with business leaders to identify opportunities for leveraging data science to solve business problems
  • Work closely with product teams to implement requirements and with engineering to implement algorithms and ETLs.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders and provide timely deliver

Technical Expertise:

  • Work closely with a team of machine learning engineers, data engineers and other data scientists to develop best in class search and ranking algorithms

Performance and Impact:

  • Monitor data product performance and business impact and act accordingly when objectives are not met
  • Develop comprehensive diagnostic approaches, a/b testing plans and scalable, repeatable best practices for our data science product development and roll out processes

WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

  • MSc or PhD in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field with a preference for a specialization in machine learning or data science
  • 2-5 years‚Äô experience as data scientist in a digital product environment, ideally ecommerce or two sided marketplace, developing & deploying successful ranking and recommendation algorithms through
  • Experience across all machine learning workstreams: using large data sets, model development, feature engineering, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development.
  • Mastery of experimental design, A/B testing, and evaluation metrics for ML models.
  • Strong skills in Python and in a selection of machine learning libraries (Keras, NumPy, Pandas, Hugging Face), deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), and big data query languages (Scala, Spark)
  • Experience conducting exploratory data analysis to understand user search behaviour, data distributions, trends, and potential challenges.
  • Experience with cloud frameworks like VertexAI.


WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
  • Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
  • Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
  • Support for your ongoing growth & development
  • Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
  • A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days



We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

4+ years of experience in software development with Python, with a strong background in backend development.
Strong knowledge of object-oriented programming principles, design patterns, and software engineering best practices.
Comfortable working with SQL and No-SQL Databases.
Basic knowledge of the Linux command line.
Experience with Clouds, Rest API‚Äôs and Microservices Architectures.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.




üîéWe are looking for a Senior Data Scientist




MAIN TASKS:

Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis;
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis;
Create and adapt models and tools;
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses;
Ensure high quality of delivery;
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models;
Create/Update some dashboards;




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Strong Expertise in Python: Proficient in running Python-based analytical engines, particularly for marketing processes such as direct marketing, inbound marketing, and web navigation.
Data Analysis Skills: Ability to collect, clean, and analyze both internal and external data to uncover business insights and drive decision-making.
Modeling & Tool Development: Experience in creating, adapting, and optimizing predictive models and analytical tools tailored to business needs.
Data Quality & Process Improvement: Skilled in developing data quality controls and standardizing analytical processes to ensure consistent, high-quality outcomes.
Visualization & KPI Reporting: Proficient in collecting, visualizing, and reporting key performance indicators (KPIs) to track the performance of models and marketing initiatives.
Dashboard Development: Experience in creating and maintaining dashboards to effectively communicate data insights to stakeholders.
Attention to Detail & Quality: Committed to delivering high-quality results, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and relevance in all data-related tasks.
Collaborative Mindset
Proficiency in English is mandatory
Hybrid role based in Lisbon or Porto







üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Marketing Data Scientist

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone‚Äôs day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Develop Data-Driven Insights: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights from large and diverse datasets across different European markets, driving strategic marketing decisions and commercial execution optimization.
Utilising ML methods (e.g supervised, unsupervised) on an Azure platform with languages such as Python, build and implement Predictive Models: Design, build, and deploy predictive and machine learning models to identify market trends, customer behaviour, and business process outcomes.
Analyze Multi-Channel Marketing Data: Integrate and analyze data from various marketing channels (e.g., transactional, firmographic, behavioral, digital data from advertising, social media, email campaigns) to assess performance, identify patterns, generate usable segmentations and recommend improvements to amplify future success of activities.
Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with marketing, sales, and data teams to ensure alignment of data science initiatives with business goals. Enable analysts to further work on data points and reach data-driven recommendations to support in strategic planning and decision-making processes.
Ensure compliance to the Machine Learning Lifecycle from Data gathering through to Deployment. Appropriate checks and balances along with sufficient validation steps should be incorporated to maintain Data Quality and Compliance (e.g. GDPR and internal data governance policies)


What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Advanced Data Analysis and Modeling: Proficiency in statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, with experience in coding with Python, R, and SQL along with a good knowledge of Databricks is important. Knowledge of tools like Power BI for translating data into insights is a benefit.
Experience with Marketing Analytics: Strong background in analyzing and interpreting marketing data, with knowledge of marketing metrics, customer segmentation, and business performance evaluation.
Multi-Channel Data Integration: Expertise in integrating and analyzing data from various sources, including digital marketing platforms, CRM systems, large transactional databases, to create in depth intelligent views of customer cohorts.
Strong Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate complex data findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders, including creating detailed reports, visualizations, and presentations.
Cross-Cultural and Regional Awareness: Understanding of the nuances and variations in marketing practices and consumer behavior across different European markets, with the ability to adapt strategies to diverse regional needs.


What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we‚Äôre ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all

Our Company

FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy

The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture

Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970‚Äôs. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today‚Äôs global marketplace.

HTML:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Marketing Data Scientist

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone‚Äôs day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Develop Data-Driven Insights: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights from large and diverse datasets across different European markets, driving strategic marketing decisions and commercial execution optimization.
  • Utilising ML methods (e.g supervised, unsupervised) on an Azure platform with languages such as Python, build and implement Predictive Models: Design, build, and deploy predictive and machine learning models to identify market trends, customer behaviour, and business process outcomes.
  • Analyze Multi-Channel Marketing Data: Integrate and analyze data from various marketing channels (e.g., transactional, firmographic, behavioral, digital data from advertising, social media, email campaigns) to assess performance, identify patterns, generate usable segmentations and recommend improvements to amplify future success of activities.
  • Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with marketing, sales, and data teams to ensure alignment of data science initiatives with business goals. Enable analysts to further work on data points and reach data-driven recommendations to support in strategic planning and decision-making processes.
  • Ensure compliance to the Machine Learning Lifecycle from Data gathering through to Deployment. Appropriate checks and balances along with sufficient validation steps should be incorporated to maintain Data Quality and Compliance (e.g. GDPR and internal data governance policies)

What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:

  • Advanced Data Analysis and Modeling: Proficiency in statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, with experience in coding with Python, R, and SQL along with a good knowledge of Databricks is important. Knowledge of tools like Power BI for translating data into insights is a benefit.
  • Experience with Marketing Analytics: Strong background in analyzing and interpreting marketing data, with knowledge of marketing metrics, customer segmentation, and business performance evaluation.
  • Multi-Channel Data Integration: Expertise in integrating and analyzing data from various sources, including digital marketing platforms, CRM systems, large transactional databases, to create in depth intelligent views of customer cohorts.
  • Strong Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate complex data findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders, including creating detailed reports, visualizations, and presentations.
  • Cross-Cultural and Regional Awareness: Understanding of the nuances and variations in marketing practices and consumer behavior across different European markets, with the ability to adapt strategies to diverse regional needs.

What Do We Offer

  • Attractive compensation package
  • Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
  • Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
  • Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
  • Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
  • Employee reduced-rate shipping
  • Great career opportunities
  • FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year

Title: Next Gen - Tech
Description:
adidas Porto acts as one of the key strategic locations of adidas globally, with a truly global environment that is reflected not only in the work that our teams perform but also in the diversity of people and talent in our offices in TecMaia. Over the years we have transformed ourselves and increased our scope to include areas that go from Business Services, Technology and Analytics, Digital, and Supply Chain Management.

WHAT IS NEXT GEN?

A 6-month program where we are building the Next Generation in adidas Porto. You‚Äôll have the chance to experience different sub-areas and work alongside other teams. This is where you have your first corporate working experience, aligned with the best adidas values and mission, where Impossible is Nothing. With onboarding designed to give you the best tools to start your professional career, you will join us as a Talent and finish the journey as a Champion.

WHAT IS TEST MANAGEMENT AT ADIDAS PORTO?

Our Test Management teams develop and implement comprehensive testing strategies to ensure the highest quality and performance standards. They also assist in preparing testing tools and generating reports. You'll assist in developing and preparing test plans within the testing tools, collaborate with the test management team to design effective test strategies, analyze test results and provide feedback to the testing teams, and participate in regular team meetings while contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO JOIN US?


Professional proficiency in English
Degree in a field relevant to Computer Science, IT Engineering, or similar
0-1 year of experience in a corporate role
Enthusiasm to quick-start your career with the best sports brand in the world


WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?


6-month full-time (40h/week) contract with a competitive salary and benefits
Hybrid work policy and flexible working hours with incentives for sports and work-life balance
International and diverse work environment
State-of-art office space and conditions


This program is set to start on April, 14th 2025. All the recruitment process will be conducted in English, please apply with your English resume.

adidas celebrates diversity, supports inclusiveness and encourages individual expression in our workplace. We do not tolerate the harassment or discrimination toward any of our applicants or employees. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Professional Internship - AI
HTML:
VORTEX-CoLab is a growing collaborative laboratory that brings together academia and industry partners in an innovation framework to drive technology transfer in the areas of cyber-physical systems and cybersecurity. We are embarking on a journey that combines cutting-edge research and agile market solutions to create world-class products with the highest safety guarantees.


WHO?


We are looking for master‚Äôs degree students in the fields of Computer Science and Data Science with technical skills and enthusiasm to join our team. The ideal profile includes:

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science - Data Science;
  • Knowledge in:

- Data pre-processing;

- Development of Machine Learning models;

- Statistical analysis;

- Scripting;

- Frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.


WHAT?


As an intern at VORTEX-CoLab, you will:

  • Contribute to the work of the innovation team;
  • Work within the Scrum methodology (training provided);
  • Develop and train AI models, focusing on GenAI, for optimization in networks and embedded applications.


OBJECTIVES TO ACHIEVE


  • Develop skills in data science and machine learning applied to embedded environments;
  • Participate in innovation projects that directly impact market solutions;
  • Actively collaborate in the team, contributing to the development of GenAI model


WHY?


If your goal is to work in an applied research and cutting-edge development environment, focusing on innovation in AI and GenAI technologies, this is a unique opportunity. Here, you will:

  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary and motivated team;
  • Gain access to training in agile methodologies and emerging technologies;
  • Develop solutions applicable to a fast-evolving market.


At VORTEX-CoLab, we combine innovative minds, academic insights, and a business mindset to transform technological challenges into world-class solutions. If you are ready to be part of this challenge, we look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Junior Developer (Recent Graduate)
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Junior Developer (Recent Graduate) for a hybrid project based in Porto Lisbon (2x/Week).




Scope: The Quantitative Research - Compute team is responsible for all computational aspects of QR teams within Global Markets. It is a transversal team whose main mandates include enforcing Computer Science best practices, maintaining and enhancing the QR pricing libraries, and building and supporting tools based on these libraries.




Responsibilities:

Maintain and enhance a large software solution, following the team‚Äôs best practices.
Maintain and manage the computational infrastructure required to build and test such solution, in coordination with the rest of the Compute team.
Eliminate technical obsolescence and drive efforts to ensure application performance.




Requirements:

Master degree (or higher) in Computer Science or any other science/engineering field with a strong interest in computer science.
Good understanding of Computer Science concepts: algorithms, complexity, distributed computation, etc.
Experience with an interpreted language (e.g., Python, JavaScript).
Experience with a compiled language (e.g., C++, C#, Java).
Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is mandatory.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to carolina.novais@decskill.com with reference CN/JD.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT consulting company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




Job Opening: Senior Python Developer




About the Role:

We are looking for a Senior Python Developer with a strong background in designing, developing, and maintaining scalable applications. The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise in Python and Django, coupled with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, hybrid environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain robust applications using Python and Django frameworks.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions that meet business needs.
Optimize and refactor code for performance and scalability.
Implement secure and efficient integrations with APIs and third-party services.
Maintain and enhance existing applications, troubleshooting and resolving issues as needed.
Participate in code reviews, ensuring best practices and coding standards are upheld.

Requirements:

7+ years of experience in Python and Django development.
Proven expertise in developing, deploying, and maintaining web applications.
Experience with database management systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL).
Solid understanding of software development best practices and version control tools (e.g., Git).
Familiarity with front-end technologies is a plus (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
Fluent in English (written and spoken).
Ability to work 2 days per week on-site at our office in Porto.

What We Offer:

A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
The opportunity to work on innovative projects with a talented team.
Career growth and development opportunities.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV in English to sofia.gould@decskill.com with the reference "PD".

HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT consulting company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


Job Opening: Senior Python Developer


About the Role:

We are looking for a Senior Python Developer with a strong background in designing, developing, and maintaining scalable applications. The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise in Python and Django, coupled with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, hybrid environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain robust applications using Python and Django frameworks.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions that meet business needs.
  • Optimize and refactor code for performance and scalability.
  • Implement secure and efficient integrations with APIs and third-party services.
  • Maintain and enhance existing applications, troubleshooting and resolving issues as needed.
  • Participate in code reviews, ensuring best practices and coding standards are upheld.

Requirements:

  • 7+ years of experience in Python and Django development.
  • Proven expertise in developing, deploying, and maintaining web applications.
  • Experience with database management systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL).
  • Solid understanding of software development best practices and version control tools (e.g., Git).
  • Familiarity with front-end technologies is a plus (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken).
  • Ability to work 2 days per week on-site at our office in Porto.

What We Offer:

  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
  • The opportunity to work on innovative projects with a talented team.
  • Career growth and development opportunities.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV in English to sofia.gould@decskill.com with the reference "PD".


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality, or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Software Engineer (Python) - People Platform
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Revolut Technology team isn‚Äôt just one of the best in the industry, it‚Äôs one of the best in the world. And we‚Äôre proud of it. It‚Äôs our driving force; our engine üöÄ

From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there‚Äôs nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can‚Äôt do.

Our Technology team isn‚Äôt here to fix legacy systems ‚Äì it‚Äôs here to build world-class financial products from the ground up.

Products that will be used by millions of people around the world üåé

You may expect our Python Engineers to work on heavily regulated banking systems, but we love the unexpected.

We‚Äôre actually better known internally for writing high-quality code and building complex novel solutions end-to-end üß† Revolut People platform is the engine behind Revolut‚Äôs historic growth from 2,000 employees in 2020 to over 5,000 employees in 2022. However, we‚Äôre not stopping there. Driving Revolut‚Äôs hyper-growth was only a proving ground for what‚Äôs to come.

Now embarking on a journey to create a revolutionary HCM tool for companies globally ‚Äìand for this to happen we need a superstar Engineer. A real Python MVP, who‚Äôll help us to build the next generation employee management tool.

If you‚Äôre passionate about creating reliable and exclusive software, while deepening your knowledge on the next HR SaaS disruptor - you know what to do! üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Creating new features using Python and Django to transform old school people processes into something user-friendly and purely digital
Writing scalable and easily maintainable code following the highest standards agreed in the community
Supporting multi-tenancy (ie multiple customers) while ensuring adequate security and data isolation
Refactoring and optimising existing implementation
Creating new reusable software components that contribute to the overall platform
Promoting a culture of product quality ‚Äî identifying bugs and issues before our users do


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience working as a Software Engineer
3+ years Engineering with Python as your primary language
An academic background in a STEM subject
Fluency in Python, SQL and other OOPLs
Experience with Django Framework
Experience with PostgreSQL or MySQL
Experience with API development & integration
Practical understanding of distributed systems
Ability to write concurrent code in IO/CPU bound situations
Experience with Docker, K8s, Ansible, CI, monitoring and alerting


Nice to have


Experience with prototyping and sketching
Multiple side projects or open source contributions
Exposure to GCP
Experience with Web Projects or SaaS platforms


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Backend Developer | Python, Django
HTML:
‚Ää

Are you a Backend Developer? Become a Rhino ü¶è and join the #crash

Who Are We

We are META, not just a company but a TEAM that will revolutionize how you see tech recruitment. Based in √âvora but working remotely, we partner with national and international organizations, with offices spread across Portugal.

We are a disruptive force, constantly charging towards big opportunities for the best professionals. Our Human 2 Human approach is straightforward and transparent, always focusing on the well-being and growth of our Rhinos.

Join our IT TEAM and bring your expertise to shape world-class digital solutions. We are seeking a motivated Backend Developer with a strong command of Python and Django to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of professional experience in backend development, with a proven record of designing and maintaining scalable backend systems.

As a Rhino, You Will

  • Design, develop, and maintain robust, scalable backend services and APIs using Python and Django.
  • Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
  • Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
  • Implement security and data protection measures.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing systems.
  • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.
  • Participate in code reviews to ensure high-quality standards and best practices.
  • Stay updated with emerging technologies and trends in backend development.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field;
  • Minimum of 3 years of professional experience as a back-end developer, specifically in Python;
  • Experience with Django and Django Rest Framework (API);
  • Knowledge of Django ORM;
  • Experience with Docker;
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools (Jenkins);
  • Solid understanding of database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB);
  • Experience designing and building RESTful APIs;
  • Familiarity with version control systems like Git;
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail;
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills;
  • Proficiency in English and Portuguese (at least B2 level);
  • Available to work remotely (based in Porto or northern Portugal).

Nice To Have

  • Knowledge of AI tools or technologies (OpenAI Service, Airflow, Mlflow);
  • Experience with React.js (Next.js);
  • Experience with file-oriented database (Delta Table - Delta Lake / Apache Iceberg);
  • Experience with unit/integration tests.

META Offers You

  • A welcome kit üéí
  • Career progression üìà
  • Health insurance üíô
  • Enjoy 22 days of vacation + Birthday + Carnival + December 24th & 31st üèù
  • Annual training budget üìö
  • HBO and Spotify subscriptions üì∫üéß
  • Coverflex üí∞
  • Exclusive discounts and offers ü§ë

Join the crash! In a world full of unicorns, be a Rhino ü¶è

Title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




THE ROLE & TEAMüë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

During 2020, Hostelworld pivoted from a more traditional functional CMO/CPO/CTO organisation to a ‚Äòfull ownership‚Äù growth team plus platform team model. More specifically, we established four growth teams to cover all consumer /hostel facing Apps and channels that reported into the CPO; and a separate CTO organisation that became responsible for supplying and maintaining common core services (such as inventory pricing, availability and checkout) via APIs to these four growth teams. Each of these four growth teams comprise resources that report into the CPO and dedicated resources drawn from the engineering function (developers, QA resources) and analytics function. Collectively, these four growth teams comprise ~ 50 headcount and are wholly accountable for their KPIs and roadmaps




We currently have four growth teams and four further central/support teams as follows;

Paid performance team : responsible for growing and optimising our paid web channels, including (web) landing page optimisation
Core team : responsible for our progressive web app (PWA Website), our organic web channels such as SEO, and more generally our core OTA funnel performance
Mobile/Social team : responsible for our iOS and Android Apps, including paid and organic downloads, CRM strategy and more generally our social network and event management (LinkUps) platforms
Supply team : responsible for all our hostel facing platforms and tools, supporting our two sided marketplace through collaboration with our customer facing teams and leading on our inventory, availability and rates position
Product Design (Central) team : responsible for defining and implementing a uniform User Interface/Experience design language across our consumer and supplier facing Apps, consistent with our Mission and Brand
Content and Creative (Central) team : responsible for defining and leading the creative direction for Hostelworld, delivering content primarily through the four Growth teams above but also supporting the wider business needs with copywriting, content writing, graphic design and video production assets
Product and Technology Operations (Central) team : primarily responsible for driving alignment and coordination across the Growth and Technology teams quarterly roadmap planning process; and managing vendor spend across these two teams which accounts for the vast majority of non Wages and Salaries expenditure across the company
Customer Service (Support) team : responsible for handling all consumer support queries, mostly via webform/chat and email across 19 languages.




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Stakeholder Collaboration:

Partner with business leaders to identify opportunities for leveraging data science to solve business problems
Work closely with product teams to define requirements and roadmaps and with engineering to implement algorithms and ETLs.
Coordinate with stakeholders and provide timely delivery

Technical Expertise:

Work closely with a team of machine learning engineers, data engineers and other data scientists to develop best in class search and ranking algorithms

Performance and Impact:

Monitor data product performance and business impact and act accordingly when objectives are not met
Develop comprehensive diagnostic approaches, a/b testing plans and scalable, repeatable best practices for our data science product development and roll out processes




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

MSc or PhD in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field with a preference for a specialization in machine learning or data science
5+ years‚Äô experience as a machine learning data scientist in a digital product environment, ideally ecommerce or two sided marketplace, developing & deploying successful ranking and recommendation algorithms in the Cloud
Expertise across all machine learning workstreams: using large data sets, model development, feature engineering, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development
Mastery of experimental design, advanced A/B testing techniques, evaluation metrics for ML models
Understanding of MLOps, model productionalization and experience in implementing machine learning algorithms end to end
Very strong programming skills in languages such as Python and machine learning libraries (such as NumPy, Pandas, Hugging Face), deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), and big data query languages (Scala, Spark)
Experience with LLMs as productivity tools
Experience mentoring more junior data scientists and knowledge sharing across their organization
Expertise in conducting exploratory data analysis to understand user search behaviour, data distributions, trends, and potential challenges.
Experience with cloud frameworks like VertexAI.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Marketing Decision Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group PLC is a ground-breaking social network powered OTA focused on the hostel market, with a clear mission to help travellers find people to hang out with.

Founded in 1999, we‚Äôre a well-known trusted brand with 240 teammates across 11 countries; hostel partners in 180 countries; and a strong commitment to building a better world in all that we do.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have a co-working space in Porto for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. If necessary, the role can be remote within Portugal with coming together for team meetings as needed.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

You will play a key role in a diverse, highly-talented Analytics & Insights team providing insights across a number of growth units including paid marketing, customer analytics and app analytics to support decision making at C and senior management level. The Marketing Decision Scientist will play a pivotal role in driving data-informed marketing strategies and decisions, with a particular emphasis on managing and optimising Google Ads bidding algorithms. As a key member of the Analytics and Insights team, this role will involve close collaboration with paid marketing, app marketing, and data teams to uncover insights, optimise campaigns, and contribute to business growth.




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

You will hone and develop a wide range of technical skills in managing our data analytics and data science products. The paid analytics team require a person who is flexible, adaptable and able to translate business needs into measurable results. It‚Äôs a rewarding experience with exciting diverse work:

Develop, manage, and optimise bidding algorithms for Google Ads campaigns (Google search results and Google Hotel Price Ads) using Python scripts.
Translate business objectives into functional code, ensuring that the bidding logic aligns with marketing goals and maximises the return on advertising spend (ROAS).
Optimise budget allocation across channels and campaigns to improve profitability.
Continuously monitor and analyse performance of the campaigns, identify areas of inefficiency, and develop strategies to enhance bidding logic.
Provide data-driven recommendations for optimising marketing spend, customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value.
Design, implement, and analyse A/B tests and other experimental methodologies to assess the impact of marketing initiatives.
Serve as a subject matter expert on data science best practices within the Analytics & Insights team.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Experience & Qualifications:

Minimum 2 years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science role, preferably within a marketing department.
Advanced skills in SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Communicate clearly and with purpose, working effectively with team members and stakeholders across the organisation.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

Essential Skills:

Competency in Python/R.
SQL (preferably BigQuery, Snowflake).
Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modelling techniques.

Desirable Skills:

Understanding of digital marketing metrics, SEO, SEM, and customer journey analysis.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with orchestration and ETL/ELT tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, dbt) is a plus.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




Our people are key to our success. Our talented and diverse teams reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences; you don‚Äôt have to meet all the requirements listed above to apply for this role.

Title: DataOps Remote
Description:
Job Description

MAIN RESPONSABILITIES


Incident Response
Understand problems from a user perspective and communicate to clearly


understand the issue.


Reproduce bugs or issues that users are facing.
Apply root cause analysis to quickly and efficiently
Find the root cause of the problem, patch it, test it, and communicate with the


end user.


Write postmortems summarizing every step of resolution and helping the team


to track all issues.


Monitor existing flows and infrastructure and perform the same tasks when


discovering bugs/issues through monitoring and alerting.


Maintenance
Monitor flows and infrastructure to identify potential issues.
Adapt configurations to keep flows and infrastructures working as expected,


keeping the operations without incident.


Database Optimization
Track costs and time of processing through dedicated dashboards.
Alert people who query tables the wrong way, involving high costs.
Track down jobs, views, and tables that are running inefficiently and occur


either high costs or low speed of execution.


Optimize jobs, queries, and tables to optimize both costs and speed of


execution.


Infrastructure Management
Manage infrastructure through Terraform.
Share and propose good practices.
Decommission useless infrastructures such as services, tables, or virtual


machines.


Deployments
Track future deployments with a Data Architect and participate in Deployment


Reviews.


Share and propose good practices of deployment.
Accompany Data Engineers during the entire process of deployments.
Accompany Data Engineers in the following period of active monitoring.
Ensure diligent application of deployment process, logging, and monitoring


strategy.


Take over newly deployed flows in the run process.


Requested Hard Skills


Google Cloud Platform: General knowledge of the platform and various services,


and at least one year of experience with GCP.


Apache Airflow: At least two years of experience with the Airflow orchestrator,


experience with Google Composer is a plus.


Google BigQuery: Extensive experience (at least 4 years) with GBQ, know how to


optimize tables and queries, and able to design database architecture.


Terraform: At least two years of experience with Terraform, and know good


practices of GitOps.


Apache Spark: this is an optional expertise we would value. Some of our pipelines


use pySpark.


Additional Knowledge and Experience that are a Plus:
Pub/Sub
Kafka
Azure Analysis Services
Google Cloud Storage optimization

  • Optimize jobs, queries, and tables to optimize both costs and speed of

execution.

  • Infrastructure Management
  • Manage infrastructure through Terraform.
  • Share and propose good practices.
  • Decommission useless infrastructures such as services, tables, or virtual

machines.

  • Deployments
  • Track future deployments with a Data Architect and participate in Deployment

Reviews.

  • Share and propose good practices of deployment.
  • Accompany Data Engineers during the entire process of deployments.
  • Accompany Data Engineers in the following period of active monitoring.
  • Ensure diligent application of deployment process, logging, and monitoring

strategy.

  • Take over newly deployed flows in the run process.

Requested Hard Skills

  • Google Cloud Platform: General knowledge of the platform and various services,

and at least one year of experience with GCP.

  • Apache Airflow: At least two years of experience with the Airflow orchestrator,

experience with Google Composer is a plus.

  • Google BigQuery: Extensive experience (at least 4 years) with GBQ, know how to

optimize tables and queries, and able to design database architecture.

  • Terraform: At least two years of experience with Terraform, and know good

practices of GitOps.

  • Apache Spark: this is an optional expertise we would value. Some of our pipelines

use pySpark.

  • Additional Knowledge and Experience that are a Plus:
  • Pub/Sub
  • Kafka
  • Azure Analysis Services
  • Google Cloud Storage optimization

Title: MLOps Field Engineer
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring an MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI/ML in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

The people who love this role are MLOps engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. They are solutions architects who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training. This role is highly focused on designing ML architectures for external customers. It is not a software development role.

This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads. We are specifically looking for people interested in solving the most difficult problems in modern data architectures. Training LLMs on multiple K8s clusters deployed on a hybrid cloud infrastructure with GPU sharing across multiple teams? Processing 10M events in real time for financial transactions? Object detection on 10k parallel 4K video streams? These are the problems we solve day to day.

Location: Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.

What your day will look like

The global Field Engineering team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.


Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, and Spark
Deliver solutions either on-premise or in public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro and AI/ML capabilities to prospective and current clients
Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap
Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets
Global travel up to 30% of time for internal, external events and customer meetings


What we are looking for in you


Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Experience in data engineering, MLOps, or big data solutions deployment
Experience with a relevant programming language, like Python, R, or Rust.
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
Intermediate level Python programming skills
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments
Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings


What you'll learn


Architect and deploy AI/ML infrastructures, data processing pipelines and multi-cluster distributed training
Wide range of open source applications and skills
Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses
Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Banking Sector | Python Developer (Hybrid)
HTML:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

  • Develop code as per the team‚Äôs specifications ‚Äì analyze, validate and review code;

  • Participate in coding sprints and continuous improvement;

  • Automation of security rules implementation;

  • Document the tool and operating mode, troubleshooting, etc.;

  • Perform tests.


Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience with of Django framework;

  • Experience in frontend development (Angular) is a plus;

  • Experienced in Agile methodology;

  • Experience using SDLC tools ‚Äì software orchestration / versioning tools, automation server, etc;

  • Good organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills;

  • Autonomous, while capable of working within a team;

  • Fluency in English.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Spontaneous Application
Description:
Well, well, well. You looked into all our open positions and you could not find one that matched you? That's ok, as Steve Jobs would say, "here's to the round pegs in the square holes"!

If yes, join us at Mobiweb, a Software House & Nearshore from Porto established in 2017. Our specialities are Web and Mobile App Development on native and cross-platform technologies. We develop in-house products, but also work with companies of all sizes and geographies, from start-ups like Moomenti (Switzerland / USA) to powerhouses of the Telco and Media sectors, such as Sky (UK).

We believe only Happy People can deliver the best products, so Team Morale is front and centre for us.

We also believe Sharing is Caring, especially when it comes to knowledge. We take in very experienced developers, but also fresh-out-of-school programmers, and we expect everyone to collaborate to reach the best outcomes, teaching and learning.

Our Ultimate Goal is to make a positive impact on people's lives and businesses by developing custom and innovative solutions for our clients.

We are in the Work Hard, Play Hard business. Can you handle it?

That‚Äôs all very nice, but what‚Äôs in it for you?

üå± Monthly Benefits that you can spend on Technology, Childcare, Transportation, Health, etc

üéÜ End of the year Bonus based on the company‚Äôs performance (in 2021 we shared 20% of our profits ü§ë)

üíª High-quality equipment (You get a Mac, and you get a Mac, everyone gets a Mac!)

üç≤ Fresh fruit and hot soup at the office (This is the winner in our book!)

üí∞ Competitive salary, based on experience

üéÇ Paid time off on your birthday

üè• Health Insurance

Still Not Convinced. Well, Here Are a Few More

üìñ This is an ever-evolving industry, so we promote Continuous Learning with free access to Udemy

‚è∞ Are you an early riser or a night owl? It doesn‚Äôt matter, the working hours are Flexible

üèñÔ∏è Work from wherever you want in Portugal (although, we have a fantastic office üòé)

‚úàÔ∏è If you like Travelling, we might get you an International Project

üëï The mandatory dress code is ‚Äúwhatever you like‚Äù

ü•≥ Monthly Get-Togethers and an Annual Big Event

üë™ Family Comes First, no ifs or buts

‚öΩ Foosball

If you got this far you are committed! We want to know you, apply today! üöÄ

PS: Have a look into one of our previous events ü•≥

We assure you that this information will not be disclosed to your current employer or any third party without your written consent. By submitting your application, you affirm that all information is true and accurate to the best of your knowledge.

Title: Senior Python Developer
HTML:
A Elevus √© um grupo empresarial que oferece solu√ß√µes inovadoras no mercado dos Recursos Humanos. Estamos no mercado desde 2001, oferecendo solu√ß√µes de RH, n√£o s√≥ em Portugal, mas tamb√©m no mercado internacional. Estamos atualmente a recrutar um Programador Phython para a zona do Porto.

- Participar em sprints de codifica√ß√£o e melhoria cont√≠nua;

Title: Doctorate Researcher
Description:
Research Opportunities

Postdoctoral research in software engineering




Work description

Collaborating with partners to assess real-world needs and objectives and develop actionable plans to drive research and engineering outcomes.
Extension and valorization of previous research results.
Mentoring software engineering researchers, including graduate and undergraduate students.
Communicating intermediate and final research results, including presentations and publication in conferences and journals.
Building connections with industry and other research groups both within and outside of INESC TEC.




Academic Qualifications

PhD in Informatics, Informatics Engineering or related areas




Minimum profile required

A Ph.D. in Software Engineering or in a closely related discipline.
A proven record of articles published in peer-reviewed software engineering conferences and journals.
Experience conducting empirical studies in software engineering.
Solid understanding of software engineering in general, including Software Architecture, Object-Oriented Programming, teamwork, and managing scope and expectations in software projects.
Research experience on the topic of microservices/cloud-native architectures.




Preference factors

Research experience in one or more of the topics: Architectural Evolution, Architectural Visualization, Infrastructure-as-Code, CI/CD, Developer Experience (DX), Patterns, LLM-supported Software Engineering, and Agile Methods.
Experience in the health domain, data quality, or data privacy.




Salary Level

In accordance with article 15 of the RJEC and article 2 of Regulatory Decree no. 11-A/2017, of 29 December, the gross monthly base remuneration to be awarded is based on remuneration level 1 of the Investigador Auxiliar category of the Public Scientific Research Career Statute, with INESC TEC applying its own remuneration table for R&D doctoral employees, with a value of ‚Ç¨3488.49 for the equivalent category.




Application Period

Since 14 Nov 2024 to 31 Jan 2025




Centre

Human-Centered Computing and Information Science




Scientific Advisor

Filipe Figueiredo Correia




What we offer

Multicultural and collaborative environment
A multicultural, international and collaborative environment that makes it easier to exchange ideas, work in networks and create synergies.
International projects
The possibility of working in international projects with some of the most important companies in the field.
Mentoring
Mentoring with the best researchers in the fields of electrical and industrial engineering, bioengineering, information technology and physics.
Self Improvement
The possibility of participating in international conferences, workshops, seminars and vocational training.
Other Benefits and Perks
Flexible working time, health insurance, discounts in hotels, transportation, etc.
Informal Events
Annual informal events, such as the multicultural party.




For more information: Click Here

Title: Junior DevOps Engineer
HTML:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the challenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:


  • DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;


  • DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;


  • DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.


Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.


We are looking for an Junior DevOps Engineer for a hybrid project based in Porto (hybrid).


Requirements:

  • Experience in Windows and Unix environment;
  • Knowledge in BCM/Control-M or other industrial scheduler (plus);
  • Knowledge in Powershell and Oracle;
  • Knowledge in CI/CD tools (Jira, Jenkins and Confluence;
  • Knowledge in Python;
  • English level minimum B2.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English to diogo.sousa@decskill.com with reference DS/JDOps.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER - Dubai, UAE
Description:
Starting salary range of‚ÄØ60,000 USDto 75,000 USD per annum‚ÄØin a zero-tax environment.

Job location:‚ÄØDubai, UAE

About Cobblestone Energy

Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the European Gas and Power markets. Established in 2017, we are shaping the future of global commodity trading with a focus on deep analytics and technological innovation. Our success is driven by our people, whom we back with real responsibility from the start. At Cobblestone Energy, excellence is valued and extraordinary talent from around the world is welcomed. Our flat organisational structure encourages a culture of innovation, granting team members autonomy and ownership of their work.

Cobblestone Values


Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual.
Relentless pursuit of excellence
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
Others must benefit from our existence.


Job description‚ÄØ

At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European electricity trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. We are looking for enthusiastic and resourceful developers who are passionate about building exceptionally reliable and performance‚ÄØdata processing solutions. You want to help the commercial team make data-informed decisions, have a curious mindset, and are motivated to understand our business better. Developing a strong domain knowledge of our industry over time is key to long term success in this role.‚ÄØ

If you have excellent programming skills, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for developing and improving applications utilizing cutting edge technologies, then we would like to meet you.‚ÄØ

What we offer in this role‚ÄØ


Competitive remuneration, with fast progression for strong performers.
A challenging but exciting, open, and fun work environment.
An opportunity to work with remarkably talented colleagues.
Vast growth potential in every aspect.
15% target bonus with further upside.
Employee share scheme participation
International relocation support
Opportunity to be embedded within a commercial team for those with strong commercial interest


Responsibilities‚ÄØ


Write software applications and programs for backend/frontend purposes.‚ÄØ
Analyse programs and apps to improve their features and functionalities.‚ÄØ
Test & debug programs and fix any reported bugs.‚ÄØ
Collaborate with the tech team to improve the performance, efficiency, and scalability of our tools.‚ÄØ


Requirements‚ÄØ


BS/BE in Computer Science/Computer Engineering.‚ÄØ
Programming experience of 1 to 2 years in Python language.‚ÄØ
Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask ...).‚ÄØ
Experience of 1 to 2 years in front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS,‚ÄØJQuery, JS, ...etc.‚ÄØ
Knowledge of APIs and webservices.‚ÄØ
Knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server ...) and SQL language.‚ÄØ
Knowledge of NoSQL databases is a plus.‚ÄØ
Knowledge of AWS is a plus / Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau, is a plus.‚ÄØ
Ability to work in a team environment.‚ÄØ
Strong problem-solving skills and analytical skills.‚ÄØ
Resilience and a determination to‚ÄØsucceed.‚ÄØ
Independent thinkers with growth mindset.‚ÄØ
Must be‚ÄØpassionate,‚ÄØself-motivated,‚ÄØand able to learn quickly.‚ÄØ
Strong sense of integrity.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Personal values that match our company values.‚ÄØ
